title: What are the significant features of Greek philosophy? - Quora

response.answer_text: PHILosophy means the love of wisdom(from zGreek Philo is love and sophia is wisdom) Among well-known ancient Greek philosophers are Socrates, the father of Western philosophy who taught,Plato and who in turn taught Aristotle. Aristotle was also teacher to Alexander the Great. Four presuppositions constitute the significant features of Greek Philosophy.One:A particular attitude towards reality.Two:The aim is not to change the world but to know reality.Three:The Greeks highly esteemed an inquiring mind.Four:Knowledge is man's reflection of nature and knowledge is an end for its own sake. As seekers and lovers of wisdom Greek philosophers studied and analyzed the world around them using logic and reason.Greek philosophers were also scientists and many studied mathematics and physics as well even though we often think of philosophy as religion or the meaning of life. Used as it was to make sense of the world in a nonreligious way Philosophy dealt with a variety of subjects including astronomy,mathematics,political philosophy,ethics,metaphysics,ontology,logic biology, rhetoric and aesthetics. The Greeks laid the foundation of WESTERN CIVILIZATION.The idea that knowledge can come from reason is a belief based on the rationalism of GReek philosophy.Reason forms the basis of modern medicine philosophy,science and scholarship. Although I share the view of one of the prior answers that you shouldn’t be asking us to do your homework, I can’t resist taking the bait. Also, I concur with others that there is a tremendously diverse range of “Greek philosophy”. Nevertheless, what I consider to be significant at its inception, and was carried on thereafter, was the idea of seeking truth and understanding through rational thought and discourse, rather than by inspiration from the gods (or muses). It seems to me there is no general ideas, in their content, that are unique to “Greek philosophy“. What was significantly distinctive was not the content but the methodology - rational dialectic.
